wikipedia_page.main:
James Noel Carroll Alder MBE (born 10 June 1940) is a British former distance runner, from Morpeth.
Alder, who was born in Glasgow, was a foster child. His mother died of tuberculosis and his father was killed on the last day of World War II. He moved to Morpeth, north of Newcastle, and became interested in running.

response: The title of most victories belongs to that of Dunky Wright who scored seven wins. North-East based athlete Jim Alder who represented Scotland in the 1966 Kingston Commonwealth Games and won a Gold medal in the marathon has also claimed five victories in this event.

response: * Jim Alder (born 1940), Commonwealth Games gold medal winning marathon runner
In 1966, he represented England and won silver medal in the Commonwealth Games marathon, finishing 5 seconds behind Scotland's Jim Alder.
* Jim Alder (born 1940), British distance runner who competed in the 1968 Summer Olympics
